In addition, in the current study, the colorimetric analysis of flavonoids varied between pomegranate leaf (orange-yellowish) with other plants (pink) and the standard (catechin, pink) under the same conditions (as below described in the methods). This visual observation may be related to the fact that leaves from pomegranate have different predominant sub-classes of flavonoids, different from that existing in the other studied plants
32 . So, the methodology, especially to normalize the use of standards such as quercetin or rutin
35 should be modified to accurately quantify the amount of flavonoids.
